thread.title: FPI holding in BSE 200 down marginally

author: financialexpress.com
title: FPI holding in BSE 200 down marginally
text:
Other Articles Tax Talk: NPS a flexible & tax-friendly investment option for NRIs Insurance: In correct lane Saving for retirement? Why annuity products make sense During April-June 2015, domestic institutional investors increased their stake in sectors like banking, technology and pharmaceuticals and sold telecom stocks. On the other hand, foreign institutional investors bought pharma and telecom stocks and sold banking and technology.
Mutual funds, too, bought pharma and automobile stocks. Kotak Institutional Equities Research data show foreign portfolio investor holdings (including ADR and GDR) in BSE 200 firms came down to $334 billion (25.1%) in the June quarter from $343 billion (25.3%) in the March quarter.
 18, 2015 12:04 am
